Describes: Assistance completing government/community forms: PR renewal, OHIP, housing, benefits, IDs.
Eligible: Newcomers, permanent residents, refugees, claimants needing document support.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Free English classes for adults 18+ to build reading, writing, speaking, and listening. CLB assessment for placement. Levels from beginner to high-intermediate. Improves communication, employability, and social integration.
Eligible: Adults 18+ whose first language is not English/French: permanent residents (PR), convention refugees, refugee claimants, or live‑in caregivers. ELT/LINC available for PRs and refugees with work-eligible status in Canada.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Guidance and study support for citizenship application, test, and interview; referrals as needed.
Eligible: Permanent residents preparing for Canadian citizenship.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Help applying for/renewing PR cards, Ontario health coverage (OHIP), and Ontario driver’s licenses.
Eligible: Newcomers and permanent residents living in Ontario.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Commissioner of Oaths services for signing/witnessing affidavits and statutory declarations.
Eligible: Clients needing witnessed documents for immigration, housing, or benefits.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Free help preparing and e‑filing annual personal income tax returns (CVITP).
Eligible: Low‑to‑modest income individuals and families; newcomers and seniors prioritized.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: EnglishVietnamese translation and interpretation for documents, forms, and appointments (non‑legal).
Eligible: Community members needing language support between English and Vietnamese.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Support applying for rental and subsidized housing (e.g., TCHC), portals and waitlists, tenant rights info.
Eligible: Newcomers, seniors, and families seeking affordable housing options.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Help applying for government benefits (e.g., CCB, GST/HST, Ontario Works/ODSP referrals).
Eligible: Individuals and families eligible for federal/provincial/municipal benefits.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: General legal information and referrals to community legal clinics (no legal representation).
Eligible: Community members needing orientation before contacting legal clinics.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Service: Certificates for: Birth & Death, Marriage & Divorce
Describes: Assistance requesting or replacing vital records and civil status certificates.
Eligible: Adults needing Ontario/Canadian vital records for immigration or services.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: VWAT Family Services partners with the Community Volunteer Income Tax Program (CVITP) to provide a free income tax clinic in Toronto since 2017. The clinic helps low-income, under-served, racialized, and unemployed community members file taxes easily and access financial resources. Participants receive one-on-one help from trained volunteer tax advisors. The service covers document preparation, interview, return review, and e-filing.
Eligible: Individuals with annual income no more than $35,000 and simple tax situations; familiea $52,500 (+ $2,500 per additional person). Eligibility mainly based on modest income; age and marital status do not affect eligibility.
Contact: 1756 St. Clair Ave West, Toronto ON M6N 1J3  info@vwat.org  647-343-8928  www.vwat.org

Describes: Guidance to evaluate international education (e.g., WES/ICAS) for work, study, or licensing in Canada.
Eligible: Newcomers with foreign education seeking employment or licensing.
Contact: Thao Pham (647) 343-8928 ext 115   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3

Describes: 1‑on‑1 resume/cover letter help and mock interviews tailored to the Canadian job market.
Eligible: Job seekers (newcomers/youth) eligible to work in Canada.
Contact: Thao Pham (647) 343-8928 ext 115   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J4

Describes: Free, IRCC‑funded resume writing. Counsellors create/update resumes, cover letters, and LinkedIn; ATS‑friendly and industry‑aligned to increase interview success.
Eligible: Newcomers, PR card holders, convention refugees, and refugee claimants eligible to work in Canada.
Contact: Thao Pham (647) 343-8928 ext 115   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J5

Describes: Workshops and coaching on job search strategies, networking, and LinkedIn; connections to employers.
Eligible: Adults eligible to work in Canada.
Contact: Thao Pham (647) 343-8928 ext 115   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J6

Describes: Skills assessment, goal setting, and referrals to bridging, ELT, and upskilling programs.
Eligible: Job seekers exploring career pathways in Canada.
Contact: Thao Pham (647) 343-8928 ext 115   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J7

Describes: Information/referrals to adult/continuing education, language upgrading, and certifications.
Eligible: Adults pursuing further study or professional upgrading.
Contact: Thao Pham (647) 343-8928 ext 115   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J8

Describes: Match clients with community volunteer roles to gain Canadian experience and references.
Eligible: Newcomers, youth, and seniors seeking experience or involvement.
Contact: Thao Pham (647) 343-8928 ext 115   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J9

Service: Free Services for Seniors in Toronto
Describes: Free programs and personalized support for seniors: fitness, walking groups, cooking/nutrition, social activities; help with OAS, GIS, CPP, Ontario Drug Benefit, Ontario Dental Care, subsidized housing; one‑on‑one appointments.
Eligible: Seniors aged 55+ in Toronto (some benefits have specific age/income criteria).
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Help seniors apply for affordable/supportive housing; navigation of portals and waitlists.
Eligible: Older adults (typically 55+) and caregivers in Toronto.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Support with OAS, GIS, CPP and other income supports; documentation and submission guidance.

Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Meaningful volunteer roles for seniors to reduce isolation and build community ties.
Eligible: Older adults interested in volunteering.
Contact: (647) 343-8928   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/   info@vwat.org

Describes: Workshops and referrals promoting physical, mental, and social well‑being; community activities.

Describes: Supportive, empowering programs for newcomer youth to participate, lead, and showcase talentsrecreation, workshops, volunteering, discussions; builds confidence and healthy connections.

Describes: Youth‑led group to meet friends, develop leadership, and volunteer (soup kitchen, Lantern Festival). Includes workshops, ‘Try‑It’ sessions, mentorship; goals: openness, social responsibility, transferable skills, strong networks.

Describes: Youth‑organized summer program with city trips (beach, pools, parks, Ontario Science Centre, ROM, bowling, rock climbing). Builds leadership/organization; volunteer hours and some paid roles (Canada Summer Jobs).

Describes: Weekly program with George Harvey C.I.: games, English practice, group discussions, and field trips; join as participant or Volunteer Student Mentor.

Describes: Workshops on leadership, communication, goal‑setting; critical discussions on racism, bullying, mental health.

Describes: Sports, games, arts & crafts, and city field trips that promote belonging, wellness, and cultural exploration.

Contact: youth@vwat.org   1756 St. Clair Ave W, Toronto ON M6N 1J3   https://www.vwat.org/

Describes: Guided volunteer placements through VWAT programs/events; earn volunteer hours; pathways to leadership/mentorship.
